{% extends "base.html" %} {% block title %} HoughLinesP {% endblock %} {% block description %}

Finds line segments in a binary image using the probabilistic Hough transform.

{% endblock %} {% block signature %} 
cv2.HoughLinesP(image, rho, theta, threshold[, lines[, minLineLength[, maxLineGap]]]) → lines
{% endblock %} {% block parameters %}
  • image (np.ndarray): 8-bit, single-channel binary source image. The image may be modified by the function.
  • rho (float): Distance resolution of the accumulator in pixels.
  • theta (float): Angle resolution of the accumulator in radians.
  • threshold (int): Accumulator threshold parameter. Only lines with enough votes are returned (larger than this threshold).
  • lines (optional; np.ndarray): Output vector of lines. Each line is represented by a 4-element vector \((x_1, y_1, x_2, y_2)\), where \((x_1,y_1)\) and \((x_2, y_2)\) are the ending points of each detected line segment.
  • minLineLength (optional; float): Minimum line length. Line segments shorter than that are rejected. Default is 0.
  • maxLineGap (optional; float): Maximum allowed gap between points on the same line to link them. Default is 0.
{% endblock %} {% block notes %}
  • The function implements the probabilistic Hough transform algorithm for line detection, described in [Matas00].
  • Due to the parameter lines in the middle of the function signature, it is good practice to use the parameter names when calling this function. For example, lines = cv2.HoughLinesP(img, rho=1, theta=1*np.pi/180, threshold=100, minLineLength=100, maxLineGap=50).
{% endblock %} {% block references %}
  • OpenCV Documentation
  • Learn OpenCV: Hough Transform with OpenCV
  • [MATAS00]: Matas, J. and Galambos, C. and Kittler, J.V., Robust Detection of Lines Using the Progressive Probabilistic Hough Transform. CVIU 78 1, pp 119-137 (2000)
{% endblock %}
